title: Bypassing Content-Security-Policy leads to open-redirect and iframe xss

profile.name: Stripo Inc
profile.about: Stripo is a lightweight and intuitive email template editor that lets users build professional looking and highly responsive email templates.

activities.message:
# Suggestion
* Automatically add `sandbox`  attribute to `<iframe>` tags
Hi @artem_nefedov . Can you change the weakness to `misconfiguration` ? Thanks

Hello @xploiterr,

Thanks a lot for this report and your contribution.

Regards,
Stripo Dev Team

Hello @jmrcsnchz, 
Please clarify why you want to reopen this vulnerability?
Sorry for the misunderstanding. I'm not asking to reopen this report. Just asking if I can make a writeup out of this? Thanks :)
@jmrcsnchz, I understand, of course, you can write about it :)

summaries.content:
CSP includes `*.firebaseapp.com` , instead of just `stripo-app.firebaseapp.com` therefore allowing any users to include their own iframe by hosting it on google firebase

>  *correction: There is no such thing as iframe xss, this should be iframe injection :))*
